text: to make a video story about a window
cleaner in New York City stand out I
wanted to try to capture what it was
like to be hanging outside a window many
stories above the ground this is david
frank a video journalist with the New
York Times that's me in the foreground
hanging out a window some 10 stories up
along with Brent Weingard
the window cleaner I was doing the story
about when I showed this footage to my
wife and daughter as well as a few of my
editors they all had the same reaction
are you crazy
after a considerable coaching I
awkwardly got outside then came the
scariest part of the whole process
leaning out trusting that that little
canvas belt that you got around your
waist attached to those two little metal
pegs on the edges of the windows are
going to hold you but once I got settled
I put the viewfinder to my eye and I
knew instantly that this was all worth
it I'm out there saying to myself wow
this is really a cool image when I came
back inside
I had a big smile on my face mostly
because I felt too had a good image and
partly because I was back inside but
truth be told and I know I'm not
supposed to admit this it was actually
fun
